entry.title: I donâ€™t like microservices, and hereâ€™s why
entry.summary: Hello everyone! Iâ€™m HÆ°ng Pháº¡m, a backend developer who was once obsessed with microservicesâ€”until I had to actually build and maintain them myself. Now, after many late nights wrestling with logs from 4â€“5 different services, Iâ€™ve realized something: microservices no longer have that same passionate appeal they once did. Why? Let me share my story in detail, hoping it will give you a more realistic perspective on microservices. When I first discovered microservices, it felt incredibly exciting. The hype, the case studies from big players like Netflix, Amazon, Uber, and Google made me almost obsessed: â€œBreak your app into small parts that can be developed and deployed independently, as you wish!â€ â€œScale each service separatelyâ€”no need to scale the whole bloated app!â€ â€œIf youâ€™re not doing micâ€¦

entry.title: Here is a 3-5 word heading for your poem: "Harmony in Daily Life
entry.summary: Here is the revised content in poem form: "The Rhythm of Lockers and Lessons" A rhythmic beat of lockers, chatter, and lessons' sway. A world where we grow, learn, and make memories that stay, In this poem, we'll delve into school life's every way. The morning rush, a whirlwind's sway, Alarm clocks ringing, breakfast on-the-go each day. A mad dash to catch the bus, minds racing ahead, Chatter and excitement fill the air, a cacophony unsaid. School is where friendships are formed, bonds that last a lifetime through, Shared interests, laughter, and adventures we pursue. Friends are our support, our confidants, and partners in every crime, Together we navigate school life, making memories that are truly sublime. Of course, school is about learning, growing, and developing new skills too, Teachers guide, inspire, and challenge us to reach our full potential anew. We discover passions, uncover hidden talents, and develop a love to learn, Whether math, novels, or mastery, school is where our strengths and weaknesses discern. As the school day closes, we think of what we've learned, accomplished, and can do better tomorrow, We reflect on aspirations, dreams, and goals we hope to borrow. It's a journey of self-discovery, navigating ups and downs with grace, Developing resilience and determination to overcome life's every obstacle and pace. In conclusion, school life is a beautiful symphony, a rhythmic beat, A world where we grow, learn, and make memories that our hearts will always repeat. As we navigate this journey, let's appreciate the little things, the moments that make us smile, And the lessons that shape us into the people we're meant to be, all the while. What are your thoughts? Let's discuss in the comments!

entry.title: Hidden Pain in Hallways
entry.summary: School hallways, meant to be a haven, often transform into battlegrounds where victims' cries are masked by laughter and chatter. The strong prey on the weak, and the popular torment the marginalized, bringing the shadows in the hallway to life. Bullies, wearing masks of confidence, charm, and popularity, prey on the vulnerable, using their words, actions, and social status to manipulate and intimidate. Their victims suffer in silence, afraid to speak out, and are left to walk alone, avoiding eye contact, wondering why they're not good enough, and crying themselves to sleep at night, feeling helpless and alone. To unmask these bullies and bring them to justice, we need to create a culture of empathy and kindness. We must encourage open communication, educate our children about the devastating effects of bullying, and teach them to recognize bullying behavior. We need to create a zero-tolerance policy towards bullying, holding bullies accountable. We can all play a role in creating a bully-free environment by being an ally to victims, speaking out against bullying, and being kind, compassionate, and empathetic towards all. Together, we can make a difference, one small step at a time, and create a bully-free world where every student can walk the hallways with their head held high, without fear of intimidation or harassment. What are your thoughts? Let's discuss in the comments!

entry.title: Day 11/30 - Git Fetch --prune -Clean Up Stale Remote-Tracking Branches
entry.summary:
Introduction
If you work with Git, you've probably encountered remote branches that no longer exist on the remote repository but still appear in your local list. These stale branches can clutter your workspace and make it harder to navigate. TheÂ git fetch --pruneÂ command helps clean up these outdated remote-tracking branches, keeping your local repository tidy. In this guide, we'll explain howÂ git fetch --pruneÂ works, when to use it, and some best practices for beginners. git fetch --pruneÂ do?
When you fetch updates from a remote repository, Git keeps track of remote branches usingÂ remote-tracking branchesÂ (e.g.,Â origin/main). However, if a branch is deleted on the remote, Git doesn't automatically remove its remote-tracking branch locally. git fetch --pruneÂ (orÂ git fetch -p) does two â€¦
